title: From 1953 until 1987, the drinking water at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina was toxic.
subtitle: The Problem
description: Marines, their families, and civilian workers stationed at Camp Lejeune were exposed to water that was contaminated with cancer-causing chemicals such as benzene, TCE (trichloroethylene), PCE (perchloroethylene), and vinyl chloride. These chemicals were found in 2 of the primary water treatment facilities on base â€“ Hadnot Point and Tarawa Terrace.
